So we have taken this approach that said we will invest in countries where leadership has made a firm commitment to some basic principles: rule of law, fighting corruption, investment in people through health and education programs, and adherence to the marketplace. What is happening, [ INTERVIEWER3], is that other nations desirous of a Millennium Challenge grant ask, What did you do to get your grant, to other leaders. text: And when we first put out-when I first put out this initiative, I was criticized by some. That is just part of the job, evidently. And it was, How dare you insist upon conditions for your aid. text: It is not anti anybody; it is pro people, and that has yet to happen, admittedly. Thank you, [INTERVIEWED]. Is that [PERSON] ? label: dialogic

text: Yes, [INTERVIEWED], your planned visit to Africa shows that the continent has become important to you and your country. label: dialogic

text: Secondly, our AIDS initiative works very closely with the leaders to design programs that meet the needs of the country-not meet our needs but meet your needs. To subsidies, I fully understand the angst about the leadership-by the leadership on [GPE] subsidies. Security Situation in Africa And some of the things they have been saying is the security. And some of them went back, after the first bout of war and were forced to come back. text: First of all, [ORG] is a brand new concept aimed at strengthening nations' capacities to deal with trafficking or terror, but also to help nations develop forces capable of doing the peacekeeping that unfortunately too often is needed on the continent. So any time you see that kind of instability, we are deeply concerned about it. text: Unfortunately, the Government, the military leader chose not to allow for there to be immediate help. No telling how many lives could have been saved or how much human suffering could have been dealt with more effectively had there not been the slow response of the military dictator. But now our aid, along with other people-other countries' aid, is beginning to move. In answer to your question, yes, our Government will respond if there is another catastrophe. And hopefully, the military people have learned a lesson: that there needs to be truthfulness at the highest levels of government. People have got to understand and listen to reality and understand that nations and people want to help when there is suffering. And so we will respond. In the meantime, we are going to keep pushing for freedom. So why it did not happen, or what is the reason-- We chose to go through the normal routes. We wanted to basically say, here is your opportunity to receive aid.
